New Records: Jaylen Brown scored a career-high 44 points, leading the Boston Celtics to a 142-105 victory over the Indiana Pacers.
The Boston Celtics improved to 21-6 in conference matchups and hold a 3-2 record in one-possession games.
Key Match Events: Jaylen Brown's 44-point performance was a standout moment in the game.
Pre-Game Insights: The Boston Celtics are strong in conference play with a 23-8 overall record, while the Indiana Pacers are struggling with an 8-13 record against Eastern Conference opponents.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Indiana Pacers are giving up 116.8 points per game on average, while the Celtics are shooting 45.8% from the field this season.
The Pacers average 12.8 made three-pointers per game, but the Celtics have been strong defensively, limiting opponents to 47.6% shooting.
Others: The game was significant as it featured Jayson Tatum averaging 28.7 points, 9.6 rebounds, and 5.6 assists for the Celtics, while Pascal Siakam scored 19.9 points per game for the Pacers.
